pros: Great family atmosphere where you get a lot of support and encouragement.

review_title: A smaller community hospital with a big heart but small budget.
job_title: RN Critical Care in Maryville, TN
pros: I enjoy the people I work with and the whole culture of the area. Being in a smaller hospital has the advantage of not being part of some big conglomerate monster. People stay there to work because they consider themselves serving their community, their friends and treat patients like family, especially when a patient dies in the ICU setting. I like being a part of that.
cons: Because the hospital is smaller, it has had to succumb to the budgeting idea of "productivity" staffing...like we're working in a factory instead of trying to treat patients and sometimes save human life, alleviate suffering. It's the same "con" of all hospitals now a days. I also believe the pay structure is way below the national average and that's not appropriate nor fair to those of us in the specialty areas in particular.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Maryville, TN
pros: My co-workers are great. They are friendly and welcoming.
cons: Low pay and poor management.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Maryville, TN
pros: great coworkers, plenty of opportunity for overtime
cons: no staff, patients that are inappropriate for the facility, high stress

pros: Great place to work yes
cons: Hospital is very very ugly

review_title: I would stay with the Blount Memorial Company
job_title: Executive Director Technician in Maryville, TN
pros: Staff is willing to help others, as in an ER its fast pace and we have no idea what we have next. We may butt heads but we always help one another to get the patient taken care of. I am proud of how the team works.
cons: Just the anxiety of not knowing if your'e performing your job correctly on a patient you haven't ever encountered something like "a burn victim" its a learning process, but worth it. Need a strong stomach.

review_title: I have worked there over 3 years
job_title: Medical Office Associate in Maryville, TN
pros: The doctors are generally nice. The location is closer to my home. The hospital will cover any labs drawn there. Free flu shots. For the most part they are alot of hard working people. They are a teaching hospital.
cons: You get strikes for using sick time, you get NO overtime no matter the reason, no paid holidays, no Christamas bonus, You get 5hrs. per pay period /2 weeks for vacation this does not increase for 5 years. You are only given a 2% raise and insurance has increased 4-5% per year. I am curently making less bring home money now than when I started. They own several other healthcare such as all the nursing homes, ETMG, as well as all the Doctors offices in the hospital. So the small town hospital is all false. They keep purchasing businesses while telling their employees they do not have the funds to give a raise or a bonus. You also do not have opportunity to advance unless you are "Chosen" no chance to bid.

pros: Wonderful employees, amazing nursing staff, approachable physicians.  There are some incredibly knowledgeable nurses and a recent change has appointed team lead positions which is so helpful to registered nurses.  I think this is a great, great hospital for new graduates!
cons: Patient load runs between 5-8 at times.  However, this is better than some surrounding hospitals.  They have a stringent policy regarding being late, but really that is understandable.

pros: Good retirement benefit with 3% automatic and will match up to another 3%. There are always open positions.
cons: It is very hard to figure out what the company stands for. They preach one thing and then tell you to perform another way. Gratitude is not something supervisors know how to offer. No overtime allowed, even though you are normally left short handed and have no other option. There is no Christmas bonus, just a ham, or bonus of any kind. Raises are very minimal if at all. The turnover rate is very high due to employee dissatisfaction. Patients also tend to be very dissatisfied because of the service that is rendered and the lack of organization within the building. The hospitals own insurance will not cover any vaccine or preventive care if over the age of 18.

job_title: Tray Line Tech in Maryville, TN
pros: I wanted to help people and bring good to the world.
cons: Over Worked, Under Paid, Lots of Gossip and Back Stabbing, Witnessed Horrible Bedside Manner, Terrible Management

pros: Great co-workes, benefits are excellent (if you use their facilities). If you are lucky to be outside of patient access the teamwork seems to be great!
cons: There is a lot of "do as I say not as I do" from management.  Others with same job title/responsibilities seem to be favored and allowed more freedom with different rules.  BMH is always changing policies/rules/job description.  They will "temporarily" vacat a position but never re-fill the position so there is always an extra load to cary.

review_title: Great place to start your career
job_title: PC Support Analyst in Maryville, TN
pros:
Everyone I've worked with and encountered at this hospital has been very nice and informative.
I would recommend employment here, at least for the IS side as I haven't worked in other departments of the hospital.
This is also my first job in a healthcare field.
cons: I believe that people are hired based on their social status (who they are related to and who they know). I don't fully agree with that. It's nice that someone who knows someone should get their application looked at a little more closely, but to hire someone, let alone promote, based on who they are, in my eyes, is wrong. Survival of the fittest: the person who does the best job should move up.

review_title: Morningview Village- Like Being Back in Middle School!
job_title: Dining Room Server in Maryville, TN
pros:
Close to home, if you live in Maryville. 
Getting to know the residents. 
Free breakfast & lunch.
cons:
Administration is very nice, but very clueless as to what actually goes on between dining staff and kitchen staff employees. 

Employees CONSTANTLY talk about one another behind their backs. Most come into work with a terrible attitude and it's a struggle to remain cheery with their constant sneering and backhanded comments.  Some are even incredibly rude to the residents - it's embarrassing! 

Apparently most employees are brand new and turnover is HIGH.  The kitchen supervisor was new and had no idea what she was doing.  Definitely does not deserve the title of "chef".

pros: Co-workers are fun and make the day go by easier.  Close to home.  Love working with my patients.  Flexible work hours depending on which department you are assigned
cons: Middle and upper management attitude toward employees is similar to “parents” to misbehaving children.  Took some “management training” classes through HR.  Was shocked at the attitude of those I met.  It’s all about writing employees up and documenting on your “problem” employees.

review_title: Good to begin career but not for long
pros: Small town friendly environment with excellent volunteer support. Good health insurance. Good they changed the vesting schedule for the retirement so don't have to stay to keep retirement.
cons: Behaves like an ugly for profit organization.  Good old boys / girls in leadership, so I suspect there is no true accountability in management or administration.  Either that or they just no longer care about quality or their staff.  Sad.

review_title: Nice community hospital but still behind the times in some ways.
pros: Family atmosphere, really nice people, good supervisors, positive attitudes, not very punitive, flexible with family problems, etc., don't lay off people often.  Pay is o.k.
cons: Not many opportunities for advancement/learning opportunities - they boast tuition reimbursement and pay for certification, but this is only if you are getting a CNA or tech, etc., or your department has money - fat chance getting it unless you are one of the lucky ones.

review_title: Very friendly people throughout the hospital
pros: Benefits (health insurance, PTO) are pretty good, not too expensive. Starting pay is $2 more an hour for RNs from what I hear from other nurses at other hospitals. Everyone says hello, etc., even the doctors! They do offer lots of extra training and certifications, which you are paid for. The nurse/patient ratio is great, especially compared to other hospitals.
cons: Small town, everyone is cousins. It also means everyone knows everyone else's business. My advice: keep your personal life at home, don't bring it to work. Otherwise, great place to work.

pros: I love working here because it's a small town feel. You know everyone and everyone knows you. You always notice a new face! I love my hours and benefits! The health insurance is awesome! About $100 a month or so for just me. The PTO is great too!
cons: I get sick often working here. The place is pretty clean but germs are everywhere!

review_title: Great learning experience as a new nurse
pros: The hospital is close to home in a small community. Fairly personable staff. You get to know people and work as a team.
cons: Some days are stressful when staffing issues arise. It's difficult to take extra patients in your team unexpectedly. Team leaders (depending on work ethic) may not be helpful.

pros: A paycheck; some of the patients actually appreciate your efforts.
cons: MICRO MICRO managed by every manager regarding EVERY thing and EVERY decision you make; absolutely NO autonomy.  Thinking for yourself or expressing opinions or asking questions will get you fired.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Maryville, TN
pros: No pros  loved it until Blount Memorial Hospital took over was ETMG they don't check into complaints of employees being bullied
cons: Very unfair place never thinks of employee lets supervisors site cordinater treat you bad unprofessional

review_title: Great place to work and lots of friendly faces.
pros: The other staff are friendly and the environment is welcoming. The salaries are not quite as high as some of the neighboring places of business unless you are coming in from the outside.
cons: Lower salaries than similar work in the Knoxville area.

pros: community Hospital, employee parking, pharmacy on site, cleanliness!
cons: PAY!, the whole package plus management.
